summary_short: Explore the legacy of Titanic survivor Margaret 'Molly' Brown at her historic Denver home, now a museum offering tours and events.
summary_long: The Molly Brown House Museum in Denver, Colorado, celebrates the life and legacy of Margaret 'Molly' Brown, best known as a Titanic survivor but also a prominent activist and philanthropist. The museum offers guided tours of her beautifully restored Victorian home, providing insights into her remarkable life and the era she lived in. Visitors can explore exhibits detailing her activism, philanthropy, and passion for social causes. The museum also hosts various events and educational programs, making it a vibrant part of Denver's cultural landscape.

collection_highlights.title: Victorian Architecture
collection_highlights.description: The museum is housed in a beautifully restored Victorian mansion, showcasing period architecture and design.

collection_highlights.title: Molly Brown's Personal Artifacts
collection_highlights.description: Explore personal belongings and artifacts of Margaret Brown, offering a glimpse into her life and times.

collection_highlights.title: Historical Exhibits
collection_highlights.description: Exhibits detailing Molly Brown's activism, philanthropy, and her role in the Titanic disaster.

visitor_tips: Book tickets in advance to secure your spot on a guided tour.
Check the museum's event calendar for special programs and exhibitions.
Visit the museum store for unique local goods and souvenirs.
best_for: History enthusiasts and families interested in the life of Margaret 'Molly' Brown.
historical_significance: The museum highlights the life of Margaret 'Molly' Brown, a Titanic survivor and prominent social activist.
architectural_notes: The museum is a prime example of Victorian architecture, featuring intricate woodwork and period furnishings.
